channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside number 28 saffron hill, 13th January
item.description:
The gully is blocked and backed up we have flooding in basement of 25/27 farringdon Road , Thames water attended and our doing further investigations, however they said this may also be a cause of the problem and is council responsibility
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Saffron Hill, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 black sacks of refuse, 13th January
item.description:
2 black sacks of refuse have been dumped in Cavendish Avenue, Sidcup DA15. towards the Burnt Oak Lan end. You sent me an email to say that this matter has been resolved & the case closed but the 2 sacks as in my earlier photo are still there at 8.15 pm & are being ripped open by foxes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutland Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road covered in pot holes, 13th January
item.description:
There are a number of potholes on this stretch of road. These are dangerous as a family member hit one in the dark and very nearly lost control of their vehicle due to the tyre blowing out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesmead, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Drain is blocked on 284 Kingsland Rd, 13th January
item.description:
Drain at 284 Kingsland Rd (east side, just next to the bus shelter) is blocked, which is causing flooding of the sidewalk and flooding in the bus lane. This was previously reported in FixMyStreet ref: 8520621 and was closed as "Fixed," but the problem has not been fixed, and it's unclear whether any action was taken. Please ensure the problem is fixed before closing again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 315, Kingsland Road, Haggerston, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole - Dangerous to drivers, 13th January
item.description:
This pothole is excessively large and has caused me to have a flat tyre. It is near a central bollard and therefore difficult to see/navigate around. Many cars are swerving late. It looks as if the council had attempted to fix this pothole, however, have not done an adequate job/maintenance as there is stone/debris/shingle sprayed across the road. Why was tarmac not used? Surely this is negligence on their behalf.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64,66, Avenue Road, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned carpet on pavement, 13th January
item.description:
Carpet on pavement is trip hazard and has been there for long enough to have gone mouldy. Lowers tone of road too.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Farleigh Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number plates down drains, 13th January
item.description:
No CCTV cameras and multiple vehicle plates down both drains. Most are cloned. Vehicles have been recovered in the area over the last two years. Please remove and send pics to police.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hervey Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Asylum Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Sharp thorns sticking out, 13th January
item.description:
The trees are completely hanging over the pavement which is blocking pedestrians access. There are branches with thorns sticking over the pavement and I have already torn my coat on them. Very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2A, Parkhurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing on West End Lane opposite the smaller Thameslink entrance, 13th January
item.description:
Temporary lights have been installed here and the buttons for pedestrians do not work and the lights never turn red leading to pedestrians getting frustrated and having to cross the road with no lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West End Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BIG pothole, 13th January
item.description:
This took my tyre out. Its a very big pothole wich is hard to see in dark. It's damaging a lot of cars but LBB dont seem to be priorirising it. £165 to get someone out to put a new tyre on - thanks Bromley...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 240, Chislehurst Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing near Woburn Walk, 13th January
item.description:
I didn't think a vehicle was going to brake to let me cross so I stopped abruptly. I slipped on the slope of the pavement to the road. I was crossing from east to west and it was the right hand side of the slope. Luckily the vehicle did brake otherwise I would have been really close to getting hit. I was wearing good walking boots but the conditions were wet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Upper Woburn Place, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Sandway Road, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Drain not working on the square, 13th January
item.description:
The drain on the square is overflowing, now ankle deep. This is a recurring issue but because of the weather it’s causing disruption to people walking through the square because it’s not visible. This is the drain cover just outside the vortex jazz club

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gillett Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
